issue.title: Bug: restore state with Label Maps
issue.body:
## Description
Unable to load state from file, with state generated with a remote dataset after using the PaintWidget on it.

## Reproduce
- Load a remote dataset (from girder for instance) into glance
- create a label map and use the paintwidget
- hit 'Save State'
- hit f5 to reload Glance
- load the state file generated at step 3

The dataset does not show up and there is an error in the console.
If you save the state with a local dataset, there is no error, everything is working as intended

## expected behavior
One should be able to restore the state successfully

issue.title: Poor volume rendering performance on large datasets
issue.body:
Poor volume rendering performance on large datasets (CTA chest). This is understandable, but perhaps more tuning could be done for managing quality <--> performance tradeoff.

For e.g. CTA chest 3D view is very sticky. When trying to rotate the view, it takes a second or two for the view to start responding to the click-drag action. Similarly, a related issue is that LAO kernel size/radius sliders are hard to drag. They should only update the rendering upon mouse button release.

comment.body: Disabling CVR, shading, while animating can help mitigate these perf issues.

issue.title: Indicate annotated slices on the vertical slider
issue.body: This is a nice-to-have feature request. Indicate annotated slices on the vertical slider for easy navigation (annotations getting lost if there are 100s of slices).

comment.body: Idea: show slice number per measurement.

comment.body:
> > There are still usages of `devicePixelRatio` that can be updated, such as `[Generic/FullScreen]RenderWindow`, the `SynchronizableRenderWindow` example, and `ViewProxy`.
> 
> The higher level render windows (FullScreen, etc) call `apiSpecificRenderWindow.setSize`. So this is the appropriate place for `window.devicePixelRatio` if I understand the current approach (internalDPR = renderedSize / containerSize) Perhaps changes to the docs to make this clear?

Ah, you're right on with that. Yes, I think we should be explicit with our docs as to what we can expect with `setSize`. I think having a `@see` from setSize to the getComputedDevicePixelRatio docs is a good idea.

pull_request.body:
<!--
👋 Hello, and thank you for starting this contribution!
📖 Make sure you've read our CONTRIBUTING.md guide before submitting your pull request.
❗️ Please follow the template below to help other contributors review your work.
-->

### Context
Scene graph node destructors are not invoked when pruned. As a result, certain references may be retained (e.g. in [vtkOpenGLVolumeMapper](https://github.com/Kitware/vtk-js/blob/master/Sources/Rendering/OpenGL/VolumeMapper/index.js#L1115)), resulting in a memory leak.

### Results
- Scene graph nodes have their `.delete()` method called appropriately.

issue.title: Fix widgets with scaleInPixels by adding RenderWindowViewNode.getComputedDevicePixelRatio
issue.body:
<!--
👋 Hello, and thank you for starting this contribution!
📖 Make sure you've read our CONTRIBUTING.md guide before submitting your pull request.
❗️ Please follow the template below to help other contributors review your work.
-->

### Context
Widget handles with `scaleInPixels` appear smaller when window.devicePixelRatio is more than 1.  Expected them to be the same CSS pixel size.

Smaller when screen "scale" setting is 200%:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16823231/195955796-c00eed6f-db91-49c6-96cd-a16684419e5f.png)


### Results
100% scale
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16823231/195955993-0acf22cb-df47-4285-a816-3473ed7ef8be.png)

200% scale
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16823231/195955906-09952795-906d-4b90-8fab-4e6701e67431.png)

### Changes
<!--
Please describe what is changing. Include:
- APIs added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- Classes and methods added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- A summary of usage if this is a new feature or change to an API. Adequate documentation and TS definitions should also be added/updated.
-->
Adds vtkRenderWindowViewNode.getComputedDevicePixelRatio using DOM container CSS pixel size and user set rendering pixel size.

- [x] Documentation and TypeScript definitions were updated to match those changes

### PR and Code Checklist
<!--
NOTE: We will not merge if the following steps have not been completed!
-->
- [x] [semantic-release](https://github.com/semantic-release/semantic-release) commit messages
- [x] Run `npm run reformat` to have correctly formatted code

### Testing
<!--
Please describe how this can be tested by reviewers. Be specific about anything not tested and the reasons why.
Tests should complete without errors. See CONTRIBUTING.md
-->
`npm run example -- ImageCroppingWidget` and change display settings or browser zoom.

- [x] This change adds or fixes unit tests <!-- Tests should be added for new functionality -->
- [x] Tested environment:
  - **vtk.js**: 25.9.1
  - **OS**: Linux
  - **Browser**: Chrome 105

<!--
Edit and uncomment the section below if relevant

### Funding
This contribution is funded by [Example](https://example.com).

 -->

comment.body: There are still usages of `devicePixelRatio` that can be updated, such as `[Generic/FullScreen]RenderWindow`, the `SynchronizableRenderWindow` example, and `ViewProxy`. And yes, the SVG stuff doesn't have to be updated, since that will be deleted.
Switched to using a for loop. I figured delete wouldn't be called frequently enough for it to matter, but might as well not have to find out and fix it later.

pull_request.title: fix(ViewNode): delete scene graph nodes
pull_request.body:
<!--
👋 Hello, and thank you for starting this contribution!
📖 Make sure you've read our CONTRIBUTING.md guide before submitting your pull request.
❗️ Please follow the template below to help other contributors review your work.
-->

### Context
Scene graph node destructors are not invoked when pruned. As a result, certain references may be retained (e.g. in [vtkOpenGLVolumeMapper](https://github.com/Kitware/vtk-js/blob/master/Sources/Rendering/OpenGL/VolumeMapper/index.js#L1115)), resulting in a memory leak.

- Scene graph nodes have their `.delete()` method called appropriately.

issue.title: Memory leak / no garbage collection (?)
issue.body:
It seems the app doesn't deallocate memory after deleting datasets. Adding, deleting and re-adding data keeps making the allocated memory number climb up.  
In the image below, 
- Snapshot 1 (529 MB) is when two datasets are loaded
- Snapshot 2 (527 MB) is when one of the datasets is deleted
- Snapshot 3 (678 MB) is when the dataset is re-loaded

![image2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/936354/197778220-319cbed6-0e3b-43ee-8755-954e27fcde3e.png)

comment.body:
I've identified two sources of leaks:
- Scene graph leaks (should be fixed in https://github.com/Kitware/vtk-js/pull/2613)
- PiecewiseGaussianWidget touch event handler leaks

issue.title: fix(Texture): update internalFormat when component count changes
issue.body:
<!--
👋 Hello, and thank you for starting this contribution!
📖 Make sure you've read our CONTRIBUTING.md guide before submitting your pull request.
❗️ Please follow the template below to help other contributors review your work.
-->

### Context
<!--
Explain why this change is needed. Please include relevant links supporting this change, such as:
- fix #ISSUE_NUMBER (from issue tracker)
- discourse post thread, or any other existing references
- screenshot of the issue
- console log of error, callstack
-->
When changing the number of components in the TestVolumeTypes example the ImageMapper would not update and there would be a WebGL warning.  Bug introduced in #1400 to allow user to set `internalFormat` manually. (Why would one want to?)

### Results
<!--
Describe or illustrate the effects of your contribution. Please include:
- comparisons of the behavior before vs after
- screenshots of new or changed visualizations if applicable
-->
ImageMapper updates when component count changes.  (Here is a hack for getting 4 components to work for ImageMapper: https://github.com/Kitware/itk-vtk-viewer/blob/7c88e1e055dc7c793561c4cdb106f9815c05a799/src/Rendering/VTKJS/vtk/OpenGLImageMapperFractional.js#L426-L446 )

### Changes
<!--
Please describe what is changing. Include:
- APIs added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- Classes and methods added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- A summary of usage if this is a new feature or change to an API. Adequate documentation and TS definitions should also be added/updated.
-->
Adds `_forceInternalFormat` to track if `internalFormat` should be updated with each call to `getInternalFormat`.  Calling `publicAPI.setInternalFormat` sets `_forceInternalFormat = true`
- [x] Documentation and TypeScript definitions were updated to match those changes

issue.title: Bug: restore state with Label Maps
issue.body:
## Description
Unable to load state from file, with state generated with a remote dataset after using the PaintWidget on it.

## Reproduce
- Load a remote dataset (from girder for instance) into glance
- create a label map and use the paintwidget
- hit 'Save State'
- hit f5 to reload Glance
- load the state file generated at step 3

The dataset does not show up and there is an error in the console.
If you save the state with a local dataset, there is no error, everything is working as intended

## expected behavior
One should be able to restore the state successfully

comment.body: Please look over #460. That should fix your issue.

issue.title: ENH: add support for reading/applying DICOM presentation state
issue.body: # Added a new operation `apply-pstate-to-image.cxx` for reading presentation state DICOM files. ### It takes two inputs: 1. Presentation state file (dcm) 2. Referenced image (dcm) It produces a partially processed output image with applied: grayscale transformations, and geometric transformations (flip, rotation) defined in the presentation state. **Output image is a 8-bit grayscale bitmap.** ## Additional information is returned as a JSON output which contains: 1. Graphics (annotations, labels) 2. Shutter: rectangle, ellipse, polygon 3. Bitmap overlays (bitmaps are converted to base64 strings and embedded within the JSON output) Related fixes to DCMTK: https://github.com/InsightSoftwareConsortium/DCMTK/commit/7f09aa73eeb9e36dc75910a375823149934a954d https://github.com/InsightSoftwareConsortium/DCMTK/commit/2136aff6b9c32ae1a5c0bf6bc458c70043bdcd6f Related commits in ITK: https://github.com/KitwareMedical/ITK/commit/b8369ebab03ac2ab7c253a67bdd8ab35a404fc5d ### Example image output (with flip + rotate 90, window/center adjustment): | Example Input | Example Output | Complete pstate representation (DICOMscope) | |---|---|---| | | | | ### Corresponding JSON output: ```json { "CurrentVOIDescription": "", "CurrentWindowCenter": 40.0, "CurrentWindowWidth": 210.0, "DisplayedAreaPresentationPixelMagnificationRatio": 1.0, "DisplayedAreaPresentationPixelSpacing": [ 0.683, 0.683 ], "Flip": true, "GraphicsLayers": [ { "Curves": [], 226.67652893066406, 219.55264282226563, 351.07061767578125 ], "Units": "pixel" }, { "GraphicType": "ellipse", "IsFilled": false, "Points": [ 465.0528564453125, 309.1492614746094, 273.8038024902344, 309.1492614746094, 369.4283447265625, 243.66427612304688, 369.4283447265625, 374.6342468261719 ], "Units": "pixel" } ], "Name": "ANNOTATIONS 0", "Overlays": [], "RecommendedDisplayValueGray": 65535, pull_request.title: ENH: add support for reading/applying DICOM presentation state
pull_request.body: # Added a new operation `apply-pstate-to-image.cxx` for reading presentation state DICOM files. ### It takes two inputs: 1. Presentation state file (dcm) 2. Referenced image (dcm) It produces a partially processed output image with applied: grayscale transformations, and geometric transformations (flip, rotation) defined in the presentation state. **Output image is a 8-bit grayscale bitmap.** ## Additional information is returned as a JSON output which contains: 1. Graphics (annotations, labels) 2. Shutter: rectangle, ellipse, polygon 3. Bitmap overlays (bitmaps are converted to base64 strings and embedded within the JSON output) Related fixes to DCMTK: https://github.com/InsightSoftwareConsortium/DCMTK/commit/7f09aa73eeb9e36dc75910a375823149934a954d https://github.com/InsightSoftwareConsortium/DCMTK/commit/2136aff6b9c32ae1a5c0bf6bc458c70043bdcd6f Related commits in ITK: https://github.com/KitwareMedical/ITK/commit/b8369ebab03ac2ab7c253a67bdd8ab35a404fc5d ### Example image output (with flip + rotate 90, window/center adjustment): | Example pull_request.title: feat: added nonlinear param to buildFunctionFromTable
pull_request.body:
<!--
👋 Hello, and thank you for starting this contribution!
📖 Make sure you've read our CONTRIBUTING.md guide before submitting your pull request.
❗️ Please follow the template below to help other contributors review your work.
-->

### Context
<!--
Explain why this change is needed. Please include relevant links supporting this change, such as:
- fix #ISSUE_NUMBER (from issue tracker)
- discourse post thread, or any other existing references
- screenshot of the issue
- console log of error, callstack
-->
In order to support sigmoid LUT based on dicom standard, non-linear LUT's need to be created on the fly any time a user changes the WW/WL. The current buildFunctionFromTable only support linearly spaced x input which is inefficient sampling for sigmoid functions. This change simply allows users to build functions from the long format as used in RGBLong.

### Results
<!--
Describe or illustrate the effects of your contribution. Please include:
- comparisons of the behavior before vs after
- screenshots of new or changed visualizations if applicable
-->
This change simply allows users to build functions from the long format as used in RGBLong.

### Changes
<!--
Please describe what is changing. Include:
- APIs added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- Classes and methods added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- A summary of usage if this is a new feature or change to an API. Adequate documentation and TS definitions should also be added/updated.
-->
- [x] Documentation and TypeScript definitions were updated to match those changes

### PR and Code Checklist
<!--
NOTE: We will not merge if the following steps have not been completed!
-->
- [x] [semantic-release](https://github.com/semantic-release/semantic-release) commit messages
- [x] Run `npm run reformat` to have correctly formatted code

### Testing
<!--
Please describe how this can be tested by reviewers. Be specific about anything not tested and the reasons why.
Tests should complete without errors. See CONTRIBUTING.md
-->
Because this is a surgical change, no new tests have been added.

issue.title: Bug: restore state with Label Maps
issue.body:
## Description
Unable to load state from file, with state generated with a remote dataset after using the PaintWidget on it.

## Reproduce
- Load a remote dataset (from girder for instance) into glance
- create a label map and use the paintwidget
- hit 'Save State'
- hit f5 to reload Glance
- load the state file generated at step 3

The dataset does not show up and there is an error in the console.
If you save the state with a local dataset, there is no error, everything is working as intended

## expected behavior
One should be able to restore the state successfully

issue.title: Cropping is sluggish on 2D views
issue.body: Cropping is sluggish (poor performance) when performed on the 2D slices. But performs much better when directly done on 3D view.

comment.body: See also #195

issue.title: Poor volume rendering performance on large datasets
issue.body:
Poor volume rendering performance on large datasets (CTA chest). This is understandable, but perhaps more tuning could be done for managing quality <--> performance tradeoff.

For e.g. CTA chest 3D view is very sticky. When trying to rotate the view, it takes a second or two for the view to start responding to the click-drag action. Similarly, a related issue is that LAO kernel size/radius sliders are hard to drag. They should only update the rendering upon mouse button release.

comment.body: Disabling CVR, shading, while animating can help mitigate these perf issues.

issue.title: Indicate annotated slices on the vertical slider
issue.body: This is a nice-to-have feature request. Indicate annotated slices on the vertical slider for easy navigation (annotations getting lost if there are 100s of slices).

comment.body: Idea: show slice number per measurement.

issue.title: Multiple datasets
issue.body:
I couldn't figure out a way to unload/reload the data? Unchecking the box in the Data section didn't really remove it from the rendered views.

In the screenshot below, I could delete the data/patient but when I had two datasets loaded, I couldn't switch to the other data or render them simultaneously.

![image1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/936354/197777932-15e2e35b-a143-4018-ba67-439d4aaf1798.png)

How about changing the default view to show enhanced scattered images?

At the very least, change the default value of the `Blending` slider to the middle. Right now, the view doesn't change at all after enabling cinematic rendering.

issue.body:
<!--
👋 Hello, and thank you for starting this contribution!
📖 Make sure you've read our CONTRIBUTING.md guide before submitting your pull request.
❗️ Please follow the template below to help other contributors review your work.
-->

### Context
Widget handles with `scaleInPixels` appear smaller when window.devicePixelRatio is more than 1.  Expected them to be the same CSS pixel size.

Smaller when screen "scale" setting is 200%:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16823231/195955796-c00eed6f-db91-49c6-96cd-a16684419e5f.png)


### Results
100% scale
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16823231/195955993-0acf22cb-df47-4285-a816-3473ed7ef8be.png)

200% scale
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16823231/195955906-09952795-906d-4b90-8fab-4e6701e67431.png)

### Changes
<!--
Please describe what is changing. Include:
- APIs added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- Classes and methods added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- A summary of usage if this is a new feature or change to an API. Adequate documentation and TS definitions should also be added/updated.
-->
Adds vtkRenderWindowViewNode.getComputedDevicePixelRatio using DOM container CSS pixel size and user set rendering pixel size.

- [x] Documentation and TypeScript definitions were updated to match those changes

### PR and Code Checklist
<!--
NOTE: We will not merge if the following steps have not been completed!
-->
- [x] [semantic-release](https://github.com/semantic-release/semantic-release) commit messages
- [x] Run `npm run reformat` to have correctly formatted code

### Testing
<!--
Please describe how this can be tested by reviewers. Be specific about anything not tested and the reasons why.
Tests should complete without errors. See CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

- [x] This change adds or fixes unit tests <!-- Tests should be added for new functionality -->
- [x] Tested environment:
  - **vtk.js**: 25.9.1
  - **OS**: Linux
  - **Browser**: Chrome 105

<!--
Edit and uncomment the section below if relevant

### Funding
This contribution is funded by [Example](https://example.com).

 -->

comment.body:
> > There are still usages of `devicePixelRatio` that can be updated, such as `[Generic/FullScreen]RenderWindow`, the `SynchronizableRenderWindow` example, and `ViewProxy`.
> 
> The higher level render windows (FullScreen, etc) call `apiSpecificRenderWindow.setSize`. So this is the appropriate place for `window.devicePixelRatio` if I understand the current approach (internalDPR = renderedSize / containerSize) Perhaps changes to the docs to make this clear?

Ah, you're right on with that. Yes, I think we should be explicit with our docs as to what we can expect with `setSize`. I think having a `@see` from setSize to the getComputedDevicePixelRatio docs is a good idea.

<!--

When changing the number of components in the TestVolumeTypes example the ImageMapper would not update and there would be a WebGL warning.  Bug introduced in #1400 to allow user to set `internalFormat` manually. (Why would one want to?)

Describe or illustrate the effects of your contribution. Please include:

- A summary of usage if this is a new feature or change to an API. Adequate documentation and TS definitions should also be added/updated.
-->
Adds `_forceInternalFormat` to track if `internalFormat` should be updated with each call to `getInternalFormat`.  Calling `publicAPI.setInternalFormat` sets `_forceInternalFormat = true`

issue.title: Memory leak / no garbage collection (?)
issue.body:
It seems the app doesn't deallocate memory after deleting datasets. Adding, deleting and re-adding data keeps making the allocated memory number climb up.  
In the image below, 
- Snapshot 1 (529 MB) is when two datasets are loaded
- Snapshot 2 (527 MB) is when one of the datasets is deleted
- Snapshot 3 (678 MB) is when the dataset is re-loaded

![image2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/936354/197778220-319cbed6-0e3b-43ee-8755-954e27fcde3e.png)

comment.body:
I've identified two sources of leaks:
- Scene graph leaks (should be fixed in https://github.com/Kitware/vtk-js/pull/2613)
- PiecewiseGaussianWidget touch event handler leaks

issue.title: Bug: restore state with Label Maps
issue.body:
## Description
Unable to load state from file, with state generated with a remote dataset after using the PaintWidget on it.

## Reproduce
- Load a remote dataset (from girder for instance) into glance
- create a label map and use the paintwidget
- hit 'Save State'
- hit f5 to reload Glance
- load the state file generated at step 3

The dataset does not show up and there is an error in the console.
If you save the state with a local dataset, there is no error, everything is working as intended

## expected behavior
One should be able to restore the state successfully

comment.body: Please look over #460. That should fix your issue.

issue.title: ENH: add support for reading/applying DICOM presentation state
issue.body: # Added a new operation `apply-pstate-to-image.cxx` for reading presentation state DICOM files. ### It takes two inputs: 1. Presentation state file (dcm) 2. Referenced image (dcm) It produces a partially processed output image with applied: grayscale transformations, and geometric transformations (flip, rotation) defined in the presentation state. **Output image is a 8-bit grayscale bitmap.** ## Additional information is returned as a JSON output which contains: 1. Graphics (annotations, labels) 2. Shutter: rectangle, ellipse, polygon 3. issue.title: Clicking on 2D view degrades 3D rendering
issue.body: Clicking on 2D view degrades 3D rendering. I think the 3D view pixelates for better performance during interaction (particularly visible when using larger dataset like **CTA chest**). But this should only happen when interacting with the 3D viewport.

pull_request.body:
<!--

Completely removes the SVG representations, since we no longer have a need to provide an implementation of this ourselves.

pull_request.title: feat: added nonlinear param to buildFunctionFromTable
pull_request.body:
<!--
👋 Hello, and thank you for starting this contribution!
📖 Make sure you've read our CONTRIBUTING.md guide before submitting your pull request.
❗️ Please follow the template below to help other contributors review your work.
-->

### Context
<!--
Explain why this change is needed. Please include relevant links supporting this change, such as:
- fix #ISSUE_NUMBER (from issue tracker)
- discourse post thread, or any other existing references
- screenshot of the issue
- console log of error, callstack
-->
In order to support sigmoid LUT based on dicom standard, non-linear LUT's need to be created on the fly any time a user changes the WW/WL. The current buildFunctionFromTable only support linearly spaced x input which is inefficient sampling for sigmoid functions. This change simply allows users to build functions from the long format as used in RGBLong.

### Results
<!--
Describe or illustrate the effects of your contribution. Please include:
- comparisons of the behavior before vs after
- screenshots of new or changed visualizations if applicable
-->
This change simply allows users to build functions from the long format as used in RGBLong.

<!--

- APIs added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- Classes and methods added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- A summary of usage if this is a new feature or change to an API. Adequate documentation and TS definitions should also be added/updated.
-->

issue.title: Bug: restore state with Label Maps
issue.body:
## Description
Unable to load state from file, with state generated with a remote dataset after using the PaintWidget on it.

## Reproduce
- Load a remote dataset (from girder for instance) into glance
- create a label map and use the paintwidget
- hit 'Save State'
- hit f5 to reload Glance
- load the state file generated at step 3

The dataset does not show up and there is an error in the console.
If you save the state with a local dataset, there is no error, everything is working as intended

## expected behavior
One should be able to restore the state successfully

issue.title: Poor volume rendering performance on large datasets
issue.body:
Poor volume rendering performance on large datasets (CTA chest). This is understandable, but perhaps more tuning could be done for managing quality <--> performance tradeoff.

For e.g. CTA chest 3D view is very sticky. When trying to rotate the view, it takes a second or two for the view to start responding to the click-drag action. Similarly, a related issue is that LAO kernel size/radius sliders are hard to drag. They should only update the rendering upon mouse button release.

comment.body: Disabling CVR, shading, while animating can help mitigate these perf issues.

issue.body: This is a nice-to-have feature request. Indicate annotated slices on the vertical slider for easy navigation (annotations getting lost if there are 100s of slices).

comment.body:
> > There are still usages of `devicePixelRatio` that can be updated, such as `[Generic/FullScreen]RenderWindow`, the `SynchronizableRenderWindow` example, and `ViewProxy`.
> 
> The higher level render windows (FullScreen, etc) call `apiSpecificRenderWindow.setSize`. So this is the appropriate place for `window.devicePixelRatio` if I understand the current approach (internalDPR = renderedSize / containerSize) Perhaps changes to the docs to make this clear?

Ah, you're right on with that. Yes, I think we should be explicit with our docs as to what we can expect with `setSize`. I think having a `@see` from setSize to the getComputedDevicePixelRatio docs is a good idea.

issue.body:
<!--
👋 Hello, and thank you for starting this contribution!
📖 Make sure you've read our CONTRIBUTING.md guide before submitting your pull request.
❗️ Please follow the template below to help other contributors review your work.
-->

### Context
Widget handles with `scaleInPixels` appear smaller when window.devicePixelRatio is more than 1.  Expected them to be the same CSS pixel size.

Smaller when screen "scale" setting is 200%:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16823231/195955796-c00eed6f-db91-49c6-96cd-a16684419e5f.png)


### Results
100% scale
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16823231/195955993-0acf22cb-df47-4285-a816-3473ed7ef8be.png)

200% scale
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16823231/195955906-09952795-906d-4b90-8fab-4e6701e67431.png)

### Changes
<!--
Please describe what is changing. Include:
- APIs added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- Classes and methods added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- A summary of usage if this is a new feature or change to an API. Adequate documentation and TS definitions should also be added/updated.
-->
Adds vtkRenderWindowViewNode.getComputedDevicePixelRatio using DOM container CSS pixel size and user set rendering pixel size.

- [x] Documentation and TypeScript definitions were updated to match those changes

### PR and Code Checklist
<!--
NOTE: We will not merge if the following steps have not been completed!
-->

- [x] Tested environment:
  - **vtk.js**: 25.9.1
  - **OS**: Linux
  - **Browser**: Chrome 105

<!--
Edit and uncomment the section below if relevant

### Funding
This contribution is funded by [Example](https://example.com).

 -->

comment.body: There are still usages of `devicePixelRatio` that can be updated, such as `[Generic/FullScreen]RenderWindow`, the `SynchronizableRenderWindow` example, and `ViewProxy`. And yes, the SVG stuff doesn't have to be updated, since that will be deleted.
Switched to using a for loop. I figured delete wouldn't be called frequently enough for it to matter, but might as well not have to find out and fix it later.

pull_request.title: fix(ViewNode): delete scene graph nodes
pull_request.body:
<!--
👋 Hello, and thank you for starting this contribution!
📖 Make sure you've read our CONTRIBUTING.md guide before submitting your pull request.
❗️ Please follow the template below to help other contributors review your work.
-->

### Context
Scene graph node destructors are not invoked when pruned. As a result, certain references may be retained (e.g. in [vtkOpenGLVolumeMapper](https://github.com/Kitware/vtk-js/blob/master/Sources/Rendering/OpenGL/VolumeMapper/index.js#L1115)), resulting in a memory leak.

issue.title: Memory leak / no garbage collection (?)
issue.body:
It seems the app doesn't deallocate memory after deleting datasets. Adding, deleting and re-adding data keeps making the allocated memory number climb up.  
In the image below, 
- Snapshot 1 (529 MB) is when two datasets are loaded
- Snapshot 2 (527 MB) is when one of the datasets is deleted
- Snapshot 3 (678 MB) is when the dataset is re-loaded

![image2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/936354/197778220-319cbed6-0e3b-43ee-8755-954e27fcde3e.png)

comment.body:
I've identified two sources of leaks:
- Scene graph leaks (should be fixed in https://github.com/Kitware/vtk-js/pull/2613)
- PiecewiseGaussianWidget touch event handler leaks

issue.title: fix(Texture): update internalFormat when component count changes
issue.body:
<!--
👋 Hello, and thank you for starting this contribution!
📖 Make sure you've read our CONTRIBUTING.md guide before submitting your pull request.
❗️ Please follow the template below to help other contributors review your work.
-->

### Context
<!--
Explain why this change is needed. Please include relevant links supporting this change, such as:
- fix #ISSUE_NUMBER (from issue tracker)
- discourse post thread, or any other existing references
- screenshot of the issue
- console log of error, callstack
-->
When changing the number of components in the TestVolumeTypes example the ImageMapper would not update and there would be a WebGL warning.  Bug introduced in #1400 to allow user to set `internalFormat` manually. (Why would one want to?)

### Results
<!--
Describe or illustrate the effects of your contribution. Please include:
- comparisons of the behavior before vs after
- screenshots of new or changed visualizations if applicable
-->
ImageMapper updates when component count changes.  (Here is a hack for getting 4 components to work for ImageMapper: https://github.com/Kitware/itk-vtk-viewer/blob/7c88e1e055dc7c793561c4cdb106f9815c05a799/src/Rendering/VTKJS/vtk/OpenGLImageMapperFractional.js#L426-L446 )

### Changes
<!--
Please describe what is changing. Include:
- APIs added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- Classes and methods added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- A summary of usage if this is a new feature or change to an API. Adequate documentation and TS definitions should also be added/updated.
-->
Adds `_forceInternalFormat` to track if `internalFormat` should be updated with each call to `getInternalFormat`.  Calling `publicAPI.setInternalFormat` sets `_forceInternalFormat = true`
- [x] Documentation and TypeScript definitions were updated to match those changes

issue.title: Bug: restore state with Label Maps
issue.body:
## Description
Unable to load state from file, with state generated with a remote dataset after using the PaintWidget on it.

## Reproduce
- Load a remote dataset (from girder for instance) into glance
- create a label map and use the paintwidget
- hit 'Save State'
- hit f5 to reload Glance
- load the state file generated at step 3

The dataset does not show up and there is an error in the console.
If you save the state with a local dataset, there is no error, everything is working as intended

## expected behavior
One should be able to restore the state successfully

comment.body: Please look over #460. That should fix your issue.

issue.title: ENH: add support for reading/applying DICOM presentation state
issue.body: # Added a new operation `apply-pstate-to-image.cxx` for reading presentation state DICOM files. ### It takes two inputs: 1. Presentation state file (dcm) 2. Referenced image (dcm) It produces a partially processed output image with applied: grayscale transformations, and geometric transformations (flip, rotation) defined in the presentation state. **Output image is a 8-bit grayscale bitmap.** ## Additional information is returned as a JSON output which contains: 1. Graphics (annotations, labels) 2. Shutter: rectangle, ellipse, polygon 3. Bitmap overlays (bitmaps are converted to base64 strings and embedded within the JSON output) Related fixes to DCMTK: https://github.com/InsightSoftwareConsortium/DCMTK/commit/7f09aa73eeb9e36dc75910a375823149934a954d https://github.com/InsightSoftwareConsortium/DCMTK/commit/2136aff6b9c32ae1a5c0bf6bc458c70043bdcd6f Related commits in ITK: https://github.com/KitwareMedical/ITK/commit/b8369ebab03ac2ab7c253a67bdd8ab35a404fc5d ### Example image output (with flip + rotate 90, window/center adjustment): | Example Input | Example Output | Complete pstate representation (DICOMscope) | |---|---|---| | | | | ### Corresponding JSON output: ```json { "CurrentVOIDescription": "", "CurrentWindowCenter": 40.0, "CurrentWindowWidth": 210.0, "DisplayedAreaPresentationPixelMagnificationRatio": 1.0, "DisplayedAreaPresentationPixelSpacing": [ 0.683, 0.683 ], "Flip": true, "GraphicsLayers": [ { "Curves": [], 226.67652893066406, 219.55264282226563, 351.07061767578125 ], "Units": "pixel" }, { "GraphicType": "ellipse", "IsFilled": false, "Points": [ 465.0528564453125, 309.1492614746094, 273.8038024902344, pull_request.title: ENH: add support for reading/applying DICOM presentation state
pull_request.body: # Added a new operation `apply-pstate-to-image.cxx` for reading presentation state DICOM files. ### It takes two inputs: 1. Presentation state file (dcm) 2. Referenced image (dcm) It produces a partially processed output image with applied: grayscale transformations, and geometric transformations (flip, rotation) defined in the presentation state. **Output image is a 8-bit grayscale bitmap.** ## Additional information is returned as a JSON output which contains: 1. Graphics (annotations, labels) 2. Shutter: rectangle, ellipse, polygon 3. Bitmap overlays (bitmaps are converted to base64 strings and embedded within the JSON output) Related fixes to DCMTK: https://github.com/InsightSoftwareConsortium/DCMTK/commit/7f09aa73eeb9e36dc75910a375823149934a954d https://github.com/InsightSoftwareConsortium/DCMTK/commit/2136aff6b9c32ae1a5c0bf6bc458c70043bdcd6f Related commits in ITK: https://github.com/KitwareMedical/ITK/commit/b8369ebab03ac2ab7c253a67bdd8ab35a404fc5d ### Example image output (with flip + rotate 90, window/center adjustment): | Example Input | Example Output | Complete pstate representation (DICOMscope) | |---|---|---| | | | | ### Corresponding JSON output: ```json { "CurrentVOIDescription": "", "CurrentWindowCenter": 40.0, "CurrentWindowWidth": 210.0, "DisplayedAreaPresentationPixelMagnificationRatio": 1.0, "DisplayedAreaPresentationPixelSpacing": [ 0.683, 0.683 ], "Flip": true, "GraphicsLayers": [ { "Curves": [], 289.695556640625, 209.14080810546875, 289.695556640625, 209.14080810546875, 141.18984985351563 ], "Units": "pixel" }, { "GraphicType": "polyline", "IsFilled": false, "Points": [ 146.1217803955078, 226.67652893066406, 219.55264282226563, 351.07061767578125 ], "Units": "pixel" }, { "GraphicType": "ellipse", "IsFilled": false, "Points": [ 465.0528564453125, 309.1492614746094, 273.8038024902344, pull_request.title: Remove SVG representations
pull_request.body:
<!--
👋 Hello, and thank you for starting this contribution!
📖 Make sure you've read our CONTRIBUTING.md guide before submitting your pull request.
❗️ Please follow the template below to help other contributors review your work.
-->

### Context
Completely removes the SVG representations, since we no longer have a need to provide an implementation of this ourselves.

### Results

SVG representations and support are completely removed, reducing maintenance on code that is better left to a third party SVG manipulation library.

Closes #2206, #1963, #1754, and #1750.

### Changes
- [x] Documentation and TypeScript definitions were updated to match those changes
- [x] SVGRepresentations are removed
- [ ] Existing widgets using the SVG representations are updated to use a custom SVG helper

### PR and Code Checklist
<!--
NOTE: We will not merge if the following steps have not been completed!
-->
- [x] [semantic-release](https://github.com/semantic-release/semantic-release) commit messages
- [x] Run `npm run reformat` to have correctly formatted code

### Testing
- [x] Widgets are tested manually to ensure the SVG behavior in the examples are correct

<!--
Edit and uncomment the section below if relevant

### Funding
This contribution is funded by [Example](https://example.com).

 -->

pull_request.title: feat: added nonlinear param to buildFunctionFromTable
pull_request.body:
<!--
👋 Hello, and thank you for starting this contribution!
📖 Make sure you've read our CONTRIBUTING.md guide before submitting your pull request.
❗️ Please follow the template below to help other contributors review your work.
-->

### Context
<!--
Explain why this change is needed. Please include relevant links supporting this change, such as:
- fix #ISSUE_NUMBER (from issue tracker)
- discourse post thread, or any other existing references
- screenshot of the issue
- console log of error, callstack
-->
In order to support sigmoid LUT based on dicom standard, non-linear LUT's need to be created on the fly any time a user changes the WW/WL. The current buildFunctionFromTable only support linearly spaced x input which is inefficient sampling for sigmoid functions. This change simply allows users to build functions from the long format as used in RGBLong.

### Results
<!--
Describe or illustrate the effects of your contribution. Please include:
- comparisons of the behavior before vs after
- screenshots of new or changed visualizations if applicable
-->
This change simply allows users to build functions from the long format as used in RGBLong.

### Changes
<!--
Please describe what is changing. Include:
- APIs added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- Classes and methods added, deleted, deprecated, or changed
- A summary of usage if this is a new feature or change to an API. Adequate documentation and TS definitions should also be added/updated.
-->
- [x] Documentation and TypeScript definitions were updated to match those changes

### PR and Code Checklist
<!--
NOTE: We will not merge if the following steps have not been completed!
-->
- [x] [semantic-release](https://github.com/semantic-release/semantic-release) commit messages
- [x] Run `npm run reformat` to have correctly formatted code

### Testing
<!--
Please describe how this can be tested by reviewers. Be specific about anything not tested and the reasons why.
Tests should complete without errors. See CONTRIBUTING.md
-->
Because this is a surgical change, no new tests have been added.
